title.narrative: WH4- Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) IN EMERGENCIES

description.narrative: By 2021, populations, particularly children and women, living in areas affected by humanitarian crises, have received a timely, quality and fair Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) response to standards (CCC)., which contributes to Disaster Risk Reduction, Sanitation, Sanitation (Covid), Water, Water (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: People living in disadvantaged areas, especially women and children and people affected by emergencies, use safe, affordable sanitation facilities and adopt good hygiene practices.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2021, populations, particularly children and women, living in areas affected by humanitarian crises, have received a timely, quality and fair WASH response to standards (CCC).

description.narrative: As part of the humanitarian response, UNICEF and its partners provided 254,916 people with access to safe drinking water and 31,606 people to basic sanitation in IDPs sites, return villages and host communities. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:26/12/2019

title.narrative: UNICEF-targeted population provided with sanitation or hygiene kits or key hygiene items
UNICEF-targeted population in humanitarian situations accessing and practicing appropriate hygiene education in schools, temporary learning spaces and other child friendly spaces
UNICEF-targeted population in humanitarian situations accessing sufficient quantity of water of appropriate quality for drinking, cooking and personal hygiene
WASH sector plans integrating climate resilient development and/or risk management strategies available
Existence and implementation of national water, sanitation and hygiene sector policy and strategy
